summary: This document is a chain of emails between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena issued to the Interlochen Center for the Arts. The prosecutor is seeking records of any tuition payments made by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities for students at Interlochen. Jeff Jocks, representing Interlochen, confirms the school has no such records as they only retain payment information for seven years.

persons.name: Jeff Jocks
persons.role: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney from Sondee, Racine & Doren, PLC who is the point of contact for the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a subpoena to Interlochen. He communicates that Interlochen has no records of tuition payments by Epstein or his entities.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: Copied on an email from the prosecutor regarding the subpoena to Interlochen, indicating he was also involved in the legal response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the subpoena. The U.S. Attorney's Office is seeking records of any tuition payments he or his entities made for students at Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Jeffrey Epstein in the subpoena as a subject for which records are being sought from Interlochen.

connections.description: Jocks, as attorney for Interlochen, is responding to a subpoena from prosecutors investigating Epstein, seeking records of any Epstein-related tuition payments.
Both are named as subjects in the same subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts by the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Both attorneys are copied on correspondence regarding the subpoena response for Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: A subpoena is sent by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Interlochen Center for the Arts, seeking information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Interlochen's Final Response
events.description: Attorney Jeff Jocks formally confirms that Interlochen Center for the Arts has no documents regarding tuition payments by Epstein or Epstein entities, as they only keep such records for seven years.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts (presumed location: Interlochen, Michigan)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to Interlochen Center for Arts seeking records of tuition payments made by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities for any students.
Interlochen's attorney, Jeff Jocks, stated the school only retains tuition payment information for seven years and found no records reflecting payments by Epstein or his entities.
Ghislaine Maxwell is also named as a subject in the subpoena alongside Jeffrey Epstein.
The email chain shows repeated follow-ups by prosecutors over several months (April 2020 to January 2021) to confirm the completeness of Interlochen's document production.
The correspondence emphasizes the confidential nature of the subpoena request.
